PM-KISAN.description: The **Pradhan Mantri Kisan Samman Nidhi (PM-KISAN)** scheme provides financial support to all landholding farmer families in India. Under this scheme, an income support of ₹6,000 per year is disbursed in three equal installments of ₹2,000 every four months. The funds are transferred directly into the bank accounts of eligible farmers through Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT) to help them meet farming expenses.

Fasal Bima Yojana.description: The **Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana (PMFBY)** is a crop insurance scheme designed to provide financial protection to farmers against crop loss due to non-preventable natural disasters, pests, and diseases. It aims to stabilize farmers' incomes and encourage them to adopt innovative agricultural practices. The scheme provides timely compensation to prevent farmers from falling into debt traps.

Soil Health Card.description: This initiative provides every farmer with a **Soil Health Card**, a detailed report that contains the nutrient status of their soil. Based on this analysis, the card offers recommendations on the appropriate fertilizer dosage and other soil amendments. This helps farmers make informed decisions to improve soil fertility and ultimately increase crop yield.
Soil Health Card.image: image of a farmer holding a soil health card

Krishi Sinchai Yojana.description: The **Pradhan Mantri Krishi Sinchai Yojana (PMKSY)** focuses on increasing water use efficiency at the farm level with the motto 'Per Drop More Crop'. The scheme provides a substantial subsidy for installing micro-irrigation systems, such as drip and sprinkler irrigation, to expand the cultivated area under assured irrigation and reduce water wastage.
Krishi Sinchai Yojana.image: image of a farmer using drip irrigation

Interest Subvention Scheme.description: This scheme provides concessional short-term agricultural loans to farmers at a subsidized interest rate. Farmers can avail loans up to ₹3 lakh at a 7% interest rate, with an additional 3% subvention for prompt repayment. This makes the effective interest rate just 4%, ensuring easy and affordable credit availability.

Farm Mechanization Scheme.description: This scheme provides financial assistance and subsidies to farmers for purchasing modern farm machinery and equipment. The goal is to make farming less labor-intensive, more efficient, and more productive. The subsidy can cover a significant portion of the cost of equipment like tractors, tillers, and power sprayers.
Farm Mechanization Scheme.image: image of farm machinery subsidy India

Rashtriya Krishi Vikas Yojana.description: The **Rashtriya Krishi Vikas Yojana (RKVY)** is an umbrella scheme aimed at the holistic development of the agriculture and allied sectors. It grants flexibility and autonomy to states to plan and implement agricultural schemes according to their specific needs and priorities, ensuring a more targeted and effective approach to development.
Rashtriya Krishi Vikas Yojana.image: image of the Rashtriya Krishi Vikas Yojana emblem

National Food Security Mission.description: Launched to increase the production of food grains, the **National Food Security Mission (NFSM)** focuses on enhancing the productivity of crops like rice, wheat, and pulses. It promotes improved technologies, sustainable farm practices, and resource conservation to ensure food and nutritional security for the people of India.
National Food Security Mission.image: image of National Food Security Mission India
